trans-unit.source: How to Set Up Tomcat7 on a Linux Virtual Machine with Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to Set Up Tomcat7 on a Linux Virtual Machine with Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to set up Tomcat7 with Microsoft Azure using an Azure virtual machine (VM) running Linux.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to set up Tomcat7 with Microsoft Azure using an Azure virtual machine (VM) running Linux.

trans-unit.source: Apache Tomcat (or simply Tomcat, formerly also Jakarta Tomcat) is an open source web server and servlet container developed by the Apache Software Foundation (ASF).
trans-unit.target: Apache Tomcat (or simply Tomcat, formerly also Jakarta Tomcat) is an open source web server and servlet container developed by the Apache Software Foundation (ASF).

trans-unit.source: Tomcat implements the Java Servlet and the JavaServer Pages (JSP) specifications from Sun Microsystems, and provides a pure Java HTTP web server environment in which to run Java code.
trans-unit.target: Tomcat implements the Java Servlet and the JavaServer Pages (JSP) specifications from Sun Microsystems, and provides a pure Java HTTP web server environment in which to run Java code.

trans-unit.source: In the simplest configuration, Tomcat runs in a single operating system process.
trans-unit.target: In the simplest configuration, Tomcat runs in a single operating system process.

trans-unit.source: This process runs a Java virtual machine (JVM).
trans-unit.target: This process runs a Java virtual machine (JVM).

trans-unit.source: Every HTTP request from a browser to Tomcat is processed as a separate thread in the Tomcat process.
trans-unit.target: Every HTTP request from a browser to Tomcat is processed as a separate thread in the Tomcat process.

trans-unit.source: In this guide, you will install tomcat7 on a Linux image and deploy it in Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: In this guide, you will install tomcat7 on a Linux image and deploy it in Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: You will learn:
trans-unit.target: You will learn:

trans-unit.source: How to create a virtual machine in Azure.
trans-unit.target: How to create a virtual machine in Azure.

trans-unit.source: How to prepare the virtual machine for tomcat7.
trans-unit.target: How to prepare the virtual machine for tomcat7.

trans-unit.source: How to install tomcat7.
trans-unit.target: How to install tomcat7.

trans-unit.source: It is assumed that the reader already has an Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: It is assumed that the reader already has an Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: If not you can sign up for a free trial at <linkText>http://azure.microsoft.com</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If not you can sign up for a free trial at <linkText>http://azure.microsoft.com</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you have an MSDN subscription, see <linkText>Microsoft Azure Special Pricing: MSDN, MPN, and Bizspark Benefits</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you have an MSDN subscription, see <linkText>Microsoft Azure Special Pricing: MSDN, MPN, and Bizspark Benefits</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about Azure, see <linkText>What is Azure?</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about Azure, see <linkText>What is Azure?</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This topic assumes that you have basic working knowledge of tomcat and Linux.
trans-unit.target: This topic assumes that you have basic working knowledge of tomcat and Linux.

trans-unit.source: In this phase, you will create a virtual machine using a Linux image in Azure.
trans-unit.target: In this phase, you will create a virtual machine using a Linux image in Azure.

trans-unit.source: SSH is an important tool for system administrators.
trans-unit.target: SSH is an important tool for system administrators.

trans-unit.source: However, configuring access security based on a human-determined password is not a best practice.
trans-unit.target: However, configuring access security based on a human-determined password is not a best practice.

trans-unit.source: Malicious users can break into your system based on a user name and a weak password.
trans-unit.target: Malicious users can break into your system based on a user name and a weak password.

trans-unit.source: The good news is that there is a way to leave remote access open and have not to worry about passwords.
trans-unit.target: The good news is that there is a way to leave remote access open and have not to worry about passwords.

trans-unit.source: The method consists of authentication with asymmetric cryptography.
trans-unit.target: The method consists of authentication with asymmetric cryptography.

trans-unit.source: The user’s private key is the one that grants the authentication.
trans-unit.target: The user’s private key is the one that grants the authentication.

trans-unit.source: You can even lock the user’s account to disallow password authentication completely.
trans-unit.target: You can even lock the user’s account to disallow password authentication completely.

trans-unit.source: Another advantage of this method is that you do not need different passwords to log on to different servers.
trans-unit.target: Another advantage of this method is that you do not need different passwords to log on to different servers.

trans-unit.source: You can authenticate using the personal private key on all servers, which prevents you from having to remember several passwords.
trans-unit.target: You can authenticate using the personal private key on all servers, which prevents you from having to remember several passwords.

trans-unit.source: It is also possible to login with requiring a password with this method.
trans-unit.target: It is also possible to login with requiring a password with this method.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to generate the SSH authentication key.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to generate the SSH authentication key.

trans-unit.source: Download and install puttygen from the following location: <linkText>http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Download and install puttygen from the following location: <linkText>http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Run PUTTYGEN.EXE.
trans-unit.target: Run PUTTYGEN.EXE.

trans-unit.source: Click Generate to generate the keys.
trans-unit.target: Click Generate to generate the keys.

trans-unit.source: In the process you can increase randomness by moving the mouse over the blank area in the window.
trans-unit.target: In the process you can increase randomness by moving the mouse over the blank area in the window.

trans-unit.source: After the generate process, Puttygen.exe will show your generated key.
trans-unit.target: After the generate process, Puttygen.exe will show your generated key.

trans-unit.source: For example: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: For example: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select and copy the public key in Key and save it in a file named publicKey.pem.
trans-unit.target: Select and copy the public key in Key and save it in a file named publicKey.pem.

trans-unit.source: Don’t click Save public key, because the saved public key’s file format is different from the public key we want.
trans-unit.target: Don’t click Save public key, because the saved public key’s file format is different from the public key we want.

trans-unit.source: Click Save private key and save it in a file named privateKey.ppk.
trans-unit.target: Click Save private key and save it in a file named privateKey.ppk.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Preview Portal, click New in the task bar to create an image, choosing the Linux image based on your needs.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Preview Portal, click New in the task bar to create an image, choosing the Linux image based on your needs.

trans-unit.source: The following example uses the Ubuntu 14.04 image.
trans-unit.target: The following example uses the Ubuntu 14.04 image.

trans-unit.source: For Host Name specify the name for the URL that you and Internet clients will use to access this virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: For Host Name specify the name for the URL that you and Internet clients will use to access this virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Define the last part of the DNS name, for example tomcatdemo, and Azure will generate the URL as tomcatdemo.cloudapp.net.
trans-unit.target: Define the last part of the DNS name, for example tomcatdemo, and Azure will generate the URL as tomcatdemo.cloudapp.net.

trans-unit.source: For SSH Authentication Key, copy the key value from the publicKey.pem file, which contains the public key generated by puttygen.
trans-unit.target: For SSH Authentication Key, copy the key value from the publicKey.pem file, which contains the public key generated by puttygen.

trans-unit.source: Configure other settings as needed, and then click Create.
trans-unit.target: Configure other settings as needed, and then click Create.

trans-unit.source: In this phase, you will configure an endpoint for tomcat traffic and then connect to your new virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In this phase, you will configure an endpoint for tomcat traffic and then connect to your new virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Endpoints in Azure consist of a protocol (TCP or UDP), along with a public and private port.
trans-unit.target: Endpoints in Azure consist of a protocol (TCP or UDP), along with a public and private port.

trans-unit.source: The private port is the port that the service is listening on the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The private port is the port that the service is listening on the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The public port is the port that the Azure cloud service is listening on externally for incoming, Internet-based traffic.
trans-unit.target: The public port is the port that the Azure cloud service is listening on externally for incoming, Internet-based traffic.

trans-unit.source: TCP port 8080 is the default port number on which tomcat listens.
trans-unit.target: TCP port 8080 is the default port number on which tomcat listens.

trans-unit.source: Opening this port with an Azure endpoint will allow you and other Internet clients access to tomcat pages.
trans-unit.target: Opening this port with an Azure endpoint will allow you and other Internet clients access to tomcat pages.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Preview Portal, click Browse -> Virtual Machine, and then click the virtual machine that you created.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Preview Portal, click Browse -> Virtual Machine, and then click the virtual machine that you created.

trans-unit.source: To add an endpoint to your virtual machine, click the Endpoints box.
trans-unit.target: To add an endpoint to your virtual machine, click the Endpoints box.

trans-unit.source: Click Add.
trans-unit.target: Click Add.

trans-unit.source: For the endpoint, type a name for the endpoint in Endpoint, and then type 80 in Public Port.
trans-unit.target: For the endpoint, type a name for the endpoint in Endpoint, and then type 80 in Public Port.

trans-unit.source: If you set it to 80, don’t need to include the port number in the URL that allows you to access tomcat.
trans-unit.target: If you set it to 80, don’t need to include the port number in the URL that allows you to access tomcat.

trans-unit.source: For example, http://tomcatdemo.cloudapp.net.
trans-unit.target: For example, http://tomcatdemo.cloudapp.net.

trans-unit.source: If you set it to another value, such as 81, you need to add the port number to the URL to access tomcat.
trans-unit.target: If you set it to another value, such as 81, you need to add the port number to the URL to access tomcat.

trans-unit.source: For example, http://tomcatdemo.cloudapp.net:81/.
trans-unit.target: For example, http://tomcatdemo.cloudapp.net:81/.

trans-unit.source: Type 8080 in Private Port.
trans-unit.target: Type 8080 in Private Port.

trans-unit.source: By default, tomcat listens on TCP port 8080.
trans-unit.target: By default, tomcat listens on TCP port 8080.

trans-unit.source: If you changed the default listen port of tomcat, you should update Private Port to be the same as the tomcat listen port.
trans-unit.target: If you changed the default listen port of tomcat, you should update Private Port to be the same as the tomcat listen port.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to add the endpoint to your virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to add the endpoint to your virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You can choose any SSH tool to connect to your virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: You can choose any SSH tool to connect to your virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: In this example, we use Putty.
trans-unit.target: In this example, we use Putty.

trans-unit.source: First, get the DNS name of your virtual machine from the Azure Preview Portal.
trans-unit.target: First, get the DNS name of your virtual machine from the Azure Preview Portal.

trans-unit.source: Click Browse -> Virtual machines -> the name of your virtual machine -> Properties, and then look in the Domain Name field of the Properties tile.
trans-unit.target: Click Browse -> Virtual machines -> the name of your virtual machine -> Properties, and then look in the Domain Name field of the Properties tile.

trans-unit.source: Get the port number for SSH connections from the SSH field.
trans-unit.target: Get the port number for SSH connections from the SSH field.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example.
trans-unit.target: Here is an example.

trans-unit.source: Download Putty from <linkText>here</linkText><title></title> .
trans-unit.target: Download Putty from <linkText>here</linkText><title></title> .

trans-unit.source: After downloading, click the executable file PUTTY.EXE.
trans-unit.target: After downloading, click the executable file PUTTY.EXE.

trans-unit.source: Configure the basic options with the host name and port number obtained from the properties of your virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Configure the basic options with the host name and port number obtained from the properties of your virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: Here is an example: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, click Connection -> SSH -> Auth and then click Browse to specify the location of the privateKey.ppk file, which contains the private key generated by puttygen in Phase 1: Create an Image.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, click Connection -> SSH -> Auth and then click Browse to specify the location of the privateKey.ppk file, which contains the private key generated by puttygen in Phase 1: Create an Image.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: Here is an example: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Open.
trans-unit.target: Click Open.

trans-unit.source: You might be alerted by a message box.
trans-unit.target: You might be alerted by a message box.

trans-unit.source: If you have configured the DNS name and port number correctly, click Yes.
trans-unit.target: If you have configured the DNS name and port number correctly, click Yes.

trans-unit.source: You should see the following: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: You should see the following: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter the user name specified when you created the virtual machine in Phase 1: Create an Image.
trans-unit.target: Enter the user name specified when you created the virtual machine in Phase 1: Create an Image.

trans-unit.source: You will see something like the following: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: You will see something like the following: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: In this phase, you install the Java runtime environment, tomcat, and other tomcat components.
trans-unit.target: In this phase, you install the Java runtime environment, tomcat, and other tomcat components.

trans-unit.source: Tomcat is written in Java.
trans-unit.target: Tomcat is written in Java.

trans-unit.source: There are two kinds of Java Development Kits (JDKs) (OpenJDK and Oracle JDK), and you can choose the one you want.
trans-unit.target: There are two kinds of Java Development Kits (JDKs) (OpenJDK and Oracle JDK), and you can choose the one you want.

trans-unit.source: AZURE.NOTE: Both JDKs have almost the same code for the classes in the Java API, but the code for the virtual machine is actually different.
trans-unit.target: AZURE.NOTE: Both JDKs have almost the same code for the classes in the Java API, but the code for the virtual machine is actually different.

trans-unit.source: When it comes to libraries, OpenJDK tends to use open libraries while Oracle tends to use closed ones.
trans-unit.target: When it comes to libraries, OpenJDK tends to use open libraries while Oracle tends to use closed ones.

trans-unit.source: But Oracle JDK has more classes and some fixed bugs, and Oracle JDK is more stable than OpenJDK.
trans-unit.target: But Oracle JDK has more classes and some fixed bugs, and Oracle JDK is more stable than OpenJDK.

trans-unit.source: The following commands download the different JDKs.
trans-unit.target: The following commands download the different JDKs.

trans-unit.source: open-jdk
trans-unit.target: open-jdk

trans-unit.source: oracle-jdk
trans-unit.target: oracle-jdk

trans-unit.target: To download the JDK from the Oracle website:

trans-unit.target: To create a directory to contain the JDK files:

trans-unit.target: To extract the JDK files into the /usr/lib/jvm/ directory:

trans-unit.target: To set Oracle JDK as the default JVM:

trans-unit.target: You can use a command like the following to test if the Java runtime environment is installed correctly:

trans-unit.target: If you installed oracle-jdk, you should see a message like the following: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.target: If you see a page like the following, you have tomcat7 installed correct.

trans-unit.target: Use the sudo apt-cache search tomcat7 command to see all the available components.

trans-unit.source: Open your browser, and enter the URL http:///manager/html. For the example in this article, the URL is http://tomcatexample.cloudapp.net/manager/html.
trans-unit.target: Open your browser, and enter the URL http:///manager/html. For the example in this article, the URL is http://tomcatexample.cloudapp.net/manager/html.

trans-unit.source: After connecting, you should see something similar to the following: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: After connecting, you should see something similar to the following: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Symptom Tomcat is running but you can’t see the Tomcat default page with your browser.
trans-unit.target: Symptom Tomcat is running but you can’t see the Tomcat default page with your browser.

trans-unit.source: Possible root case
trans-unit.target: Possible root case

trans-unit.source: The tomcat listen port is not same as the Private Port of your virtual machine's endpoint for tomcat traffic.
trans-unit.target: The tomcat listen port is not same as the Private Port of your virtual machine's endpoint for tomcat traffic.

trans-unit.source: Check your Public Port and Private Port endpoint settings and make sure the Private Port is same as the tomcat listen port.
trans-unit.target: Check your Public Port and Private Port endpoint settings and make sure the Private Port is same as the tomcat listen port.

trans-unit.source: See Phase 1: Create an Image for instructions on configuring endpoints for your virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: See Phase 1: Create an Image for instructions on configuring endpoints for your virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: To determine the tomcat listen port, open /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf (Red Hat release) or /etc/tomcat7/server.xml (Debian release).
trans-unit.target: To determine the tomcat listen port, open /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf (Red Hat release) or /etc/tomcat7/server.xml (Debian release).

trans-unit.source: By default, the tomcat listen port is 8080.
trans-unit.target: By default, the tomcat listen port is 8080.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example:

trans-unit.source: If you are using a virtual machine like Debian or Ubuntu and you want to change the default port of Tomcat Listen (for example 8081), you should also open the port for the OS.
trans-unit.target: If you are using a virtual machine like Debian or Ubuntu and you want to change the default port of Tomcat Listen (for example 8081), you should also open the port for the OS.

trans-unit.source: First, open the Profile:
trans-unit.target: First, open the Profile:

trans-unit.source: Then uncomment the last line and change “no” to “yes”.
trans-unit.target: Then uncomment the last line and change “no” to “yes”.

trans-unit.source: The firewall has disabled the listen port of tomcat.
trans-unit.target: The firewall has disabled the listen port of tomcat.

trans-unit.source: If you can only see the Tomcat default page from the local host, then the problem is most likely that the port which is listened by tomcat is blocked by the firewall.
trans-unit.target: If you can only see the Tomcat default page from the local host, then the problem is most likely that the port which is listened by tomcat is blocked by the firewall.

trans-unit.source: You can use the w3m tool to browse the web page.
trans-unit.target: You can use the w3m tool to browse the web page.

trans-unit.source: The following commands install w3m and browse to the Tomcat default page:
trans-unit.target: The following commands install w3m and browse to the Tomcat default page:

trans-unit.source: Solution
trans-unit.target: Solution

trans-unit.source: If the tomcat listen port is not same as the Private Port of the endpoint for traffic to the virtual machine, you need change the Private Port to be the same as the tomcat listen port.
trans-unit.target: If the tomcat listen port is not same as the Private Port of the endpoint for traffic to the virtual machine, you need change the Private Port to be the same as the tomcat listen port.

trans-unit.source: If the issue is caused by the firewall/iptables, add the following lines to /etc/sysconfig/iptables:
trans-unit.target: If the issue is caused by the firewall/iptables, add the following lines to /etc/sysconfig/iptables:

trans-unit.source: Note that the second line is only needed for https traffic.
trans-unit.target: Note that the second line is only needed for https traffic.

trans-unit.source: Make sure this is above any lines that would globally restrict access, such as the following:
trans-unit.target: Make sure this is above any lines that would globally restrict access, such as the following:

trans-unit.source: To reload the iptables, run the following command:
trans-unit.target: To reload the iptables, run the following command:

trans-unit.source: This has been tested on CentOS 6.3.
trans-unit.target: This has been tested on CentOS 6.3.

trans-unit.source: Symptom When you use any SFTP client (such as FileZilla) to connect to your virtual machine and navigate to /var/lib/tomcat7/webapps/ to publish your site, you get an error message similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: Symptom When you use any SFTP client (such as FileZilla) to connect to your virtual machine and navigate to /var/lib/tomcat7/webapps/ to publish your site, you get an error message similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Possible root case You have no permissions to access the /var/lib/tomcat7/webapps folder.
trans-unit.target: Possible root case You have no permissions to access the /var/lib/tomcat7/webapps folder.

trans-unit.source: Solution You need get permission from the root account.
trans-unit.target: Solution You need get permission from the root account.

trans-unit.source: You can change the ownership of that folder from root to the username you used when provisioning the machine.
trans-unit.target: You can change the ownership of that folder from root to the username you used when provisioning the machine.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example with the azureuser account name:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example with the azureuser account name:

trans-unit.source: Use the -R option to apply the permissions for all files inside of a directory too.
trans-unit.target: Use the -R option to apply the permissions for all files inside of a directory too.

trans-unit.source: Note that this command also works for directories.
trans-unit.target: Note that this command also works for directories.

trans-unit.source: The -R option changes the permissions for all files and directories inside of the directory.
trans-unit.target: The -R option changes the permissions for all files and directories inside of the directory.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example:

trans-unit.source: This command changes ownership (both user and group) for all files and directories inside of directory and directory itself.
trans-unit.target: This command changes ownership (both user and group) for all files and directories inside of directory and directory itself.

trans-unit.source: The following command only changes the permission of the folder directory but leaves the files and folders inside the directory alone.
trans-unit.target: The following command only changes the permission of the folder directory but leaves the files and folders inside the directory alone.
